title: Excessive Result Nesting (Ok(Ok(...))) in MCP Handlers
description: The MCP bridge handlers exhibit a code smell with `Ok(Ok(ServerMessage::Error))` matching. This double wrapping indicates redundant Result layers (likely Transport + Logic) that should be flattened for cleaner error handling.
resolution: Fixed - recv_from_daemon_with_timeout flattens Result by returning inner result directly and mapping timeout to McpError::ResponseTimeout
